reviews.review_msg: Interesting lectures, plus he's very accessible & friendly.  However does feel a little bogged down in minutia at times as he focuses quite a bit on the wording of journal articles + theories/frameworks. Good prof overall though! Final & essay were challenging but not overwhelming. Prior Middle East knowledge helps. Didn't use sourcebook much.
One of the best history professors.

What a character! Tests are easy bc the terms he gives you essentially are the test. VERY prone to going on LONNNG tangents. You never need to do readings for the Islamic Civ course tutorial bc it's all group discussions in small groups he doesn't supervise. In fact half the time he leaves the room. Very involved in Islamic studies conferences.
Amazing Prof. Derryl is a great teacher, a great intellectual in Islamic studies. He is very approachable with help. It was so far the best and most interesting class I have taken at SFU

So dry. So boring. One of those profs that's been around forever. Doesn't seem to have any passion although he is knowledgable. Take it if you have to, but if you're looking to be fascinated, don't bother.

Great Prof!  No need to read text just write down everything he says and memorize it and you will def. get an A! I bet the other commenters did not even take many notes in class and just studied the text!

Perhaps the most knowledgeable history prof with his subject. It was a joy to hear him lecture. If you show up on presentation day not knowing what you're doing, he'll be very hard on you. Otherwise, going to his office hours were incredibly useful. I would talk more classes with him.
In contention for best Prof at SFU.  Excellent Prof, equally as great person.  Agreed with other comment, would attend lectures just for fun.

knows alot about what he teaches, and likes to use lots of unnecessary foreign terminology and convoluted academic speak in order to prove it. does not make his subject matter accessible. avoid him if possible.
Totally unorganized and extremely hard to follow during lecture. I won't deny that he is incredibly passionate about what he teaches but is hard to understand.

Highly recommend recording all lectures since he speaks for 2 hours non-stop. The book is useful if you're planning on receiving a B+, A-, or A because it is very consistent with Dr. DM's opinions and lectures. Otherwise it is not a difficult course. I've never seen any prof as polite and as reasonable as him.
Very difficult class, wouldn't recommend.
One of the hardest classes I've taken at university... interesting, but really difficult.

He is very interested in what he teaches, but has a tendency of going of topic very easily. The text is not helpful and his lectures, which are not recorded, are the only source to study from. Expectations and criteria for assignments was unclear and had a significant impact on the marks.

maclean is the best professor in sfu..lectures are amazing with loads of detail....nobody knows more about islam and the subject material than he does...he speaks a lot and fast and it tough to write everything but make sure do dat.textbook is useless..a little strict marker but he usually talks about the material he tests u on...wrk hard n do wel

He is really difficult to understand for all of you that say he's a great speaker he is not. Beware! he does not make sense and his lectures are incoherent. he is not helpful wit his assingments either i went to him more then one n told him i was struggling n he offered no help! i was forced to jus stop going to his class. AVOID AT ALL COST!

Darryl is the BEST prof that I have ever had. He'll always give you as much time as you need and explain everything thoroughly. He is down to earth, but VERY intelligent and knows his topic inside and out. You must be willing to work hard otherwise you WILL be confused as Islamic history is so rich. IHEARTDM HE IS THE BEST PROF EVER

An excellent Prof who knows EVERYTHING about Islam.  Expectations for the course are fair, but the Hodgson textbook is useless.  His choice of TA ont he other hand is atrocious.  A useless imbecile who couldnt care less about the subject matter, or showing up to tutorials.

I don't think I've ever had a professor who knows as much about his subject as MacLean. Lectures can be a little convoluted; he tends to go on tangents that don't directly involve the course material. However, he is extremely informative and an all around great professor.

Very passionate. Good speaker. Great topic. MacLean is a very fair marker. 2 probs though. The Hodgson textbook is useless, too abstract for a survey course. And he's always behind in lectures. Tests were fair, expectations for the paper were rather vague, start planning ahead, 1001 nights. Would definitely recommend MacLean and the course.
wonderful prof, nice person, gets carried away speaking abt the subject sumtimes but attendng his lecturs nd taking comprehensive notes is the key

After 3 years, I can safely say that he is the best prof I have ever had.  He is the most kind, understanding, and just NICE person you will ever meet.  He holds an incredible amount of information and seems to know absolutely EVERYTHING.  There is no question you can't ask that he can't give a 10 minute answer to.  TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!  So great!
I loved this man.  He was so wonderful.  I would go to his lectures for fun if I could.  He was extremely interesting and really sparked my interest in middle eastern history.
awesome history professor. if you are interested in the middle east, take a course with him.
He knew his stuff and you can tell that he is extremely interested in the subject. However, he is very unclear regarding assignments and what direction you should be following.
Great Prof. Enjoys others and thus we enjoy him! Wow that sounded lame; he's a real intelligent and nice man. Have a tea with him sometime and chat about Islam. You'll enjoy.

All in all, good prof w/ succinct lectures. The readings, except the sourcebook, are almost useless. All you need to read is the into and conc. However, if one is taking this class for Group 3 requirements and has no background in Islamc history, I would highly recommend reading a few books on Islamic history and a survey of Iranian history.
He was a great teacher who was not past helping students when they needed it. Because of him, I learned much about the history of my people.
No Comments
Great prof.
Interesting stories.

Not an easy class, but MacLean is an interesting and compelling lecturer who also makes good use of time. Tends to go over class time, but is very fair about marking and material that he tests on. No real need to read or even buy the textbook(Hodgson), but missing lectures is a really bad idea.
Very nice man.  Knows his stuff!  The TA was great.  The text was garbage.

MacLean is a great teacher. Interesting (though difficult lectures). The kind of prof that I could listen to for hours. Skim the readings if you must, though the lectures go over everything that would be covered on a test. Reccomended only for those who are REALLY interested in Islamic History.
Gets way  behind in lecture. Text is useless. All you need are the notes.
very tough course...hard marker and lectures are incoherent
hes ok, talks too much though.
He's a doll - unbelievably nice. Actually interested in his students, which is unusual for a prof who's been around that long.
Good prof, poorly delivered but interesting lectures.  Rather meaningless assignments.  But he's nice and you'll have fun.  Yay!
Approachable, friendly,and extremely knowledeable with regards to Islam and India. Must have been a Sufi Poet at one point in his life, cares about the subject matter very much.
I found his lectures where never cohesive and went back and forth in time periods. His lack of helpfulness for his papers made this course truly a disappointment.

I had him as a prof in the early 90's and he was great.  He knows his stuff and gets you excited about the topic.  With all the stuff in the news about the Middle East, Derryll explains the historical context of many of the conflicts and the issues.
Cleveland a better prof for Middle Eastern material. Unless you prefer intellectual history, then Maclean is the guy for you.
The book is useless and hard to read. Just study the notes and you'll nail this class. Despite all the noise me and my friends made he never complained so he gets extra marks for that too.
He's great. I think he spent his youth stoned in India. Take his courses
Hard, but reasonable. Lots of reading.
Excellent prof.  I wish my grandparents would adopt him.
Maclean knows his stuff, but wish he had better reading material.
My favorite prof . If you are at all interested in history, take his courses!
great prof, but he uses long words take a dictionary to class
Knows his stuff-makes it so interesting. Taught all basics of Islam.
No Comments
This guy rocks!  He knows his stuff and he's interesting!
